title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Green, yellow and red colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite upper center, bracket showing repeat and "1/24"; in graphite on mount along right side on paper: "?", [arrow] "warp"; in graphite upper right cornar: 12
Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 30; in graphite right center: 1 11/16 - 8 in 13 1/2
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Stylized leaf and flower pattern arranged geometrically using right triangles, circles and quatrafoil shapes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Green, yellow and red colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-448.
